narrative.title: 7Th Armoured Division - 1941Q3

situation.formation: Formed as Mobile Division (Egypt) 1938, redesignated 7th Armoured Division 1939-10-01

q3_1941_status.post_battleaxe: Recovering and rebuilding after Operation Battleaxe failure (June 15-17, 1941)
q3_1941_status.losses: 91 tanks lost at Battleaxe (48% of engaged strength)
q3_1941_status.command_change: O'Moore Creagh replaced by William Gott (August 4, 1941)
q3_1941_status.rebuilding: Receiving tank replacements, new Crusader Mk II variants, first Stuart tanks
q3_1941_status.training: Incorporating Battleaxe lessons: better combined arms, AT gun inadequacy
q3_1941_status.preparation: Building up strength for Operation Crusader offensive (November 1941)

situation.previous_operations: Operation Compass (Dec 1940-Feb 1941): Destroyed Italian 10th Army. Operation Brevity (May 1941). Operation Battleaxe (June 1941).

narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.
